pr_title: Add test infrastructure to run queries using native workers

timeline.message:
Add test infrastructure to run queries using native workers

Extend HiveQueryRunner and DistributedQueryRunner to allow for setting up a
Java-based coordinator and a set of native workers. Native workers are created
by launching separate processes using native binary. The path to the binary is
specified using PRESTO_SERVER environment variable. The new test that uses
this infrastructure, TestHiveNativeWorkersQueries.java, is disabled by
default. In the future, we'll figure out how to get native worker binary on a
CI machine to enable this test.

The new test passed locally.

timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: It feels like we can fairly easily squash these three checks on nativeWorkerLauncher into one?
timeline.author: tdcmeehan
tdcmeehan
tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: Any reason we can't do this just once outside of the lambda?
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText: @tdcmeehan We need discoveryUri which is available only from within the callback.
replies.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: Rather than presuming the existence of /tmp, can we just use Files.createTempDirectory(prefix);?  We could also tag the prefix with the test class name of this test (for discoverability, in case it accidentally creates too many local temp directories).
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: This is a small nit, but I think it would be preferable to make it clear these come from the environment, but having two methods, one which takes these as arguments, and an outer one which passes them in from the environment.
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: Maybe annotate this as @Experimental so people who are unawares don't try to run it locally (I presume there's no well known way to get this to work right now?)
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText: Would you like me to use com.facebook.presto.spi.api.Experimental or something else? Anyone can run it locally, but they would need to build native presto worker first.
replies.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText:
When I look at a Testng test in our codebase, I have the expectation of simply being able to run it in IntelliJ.  Because the setup here is more complicated and, as I understand it, requires some external setup which isn't captured or documented in this test, I'm just trying to think of a way to make it clear to people that you can't just do that.
Ideally, it would be really nice to develop some tools to run these locally, presuming you have Docker or some containerization software locally running on an Intel CPU.  But that sounds really complicated, so I just though that the Experimental annotation from SPI would do.  Open to other suggestions to make it clear (perhaps also detailed comments explaining how to run locally).
replies.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText: I'll add @experimental from spi. I'd be happy to add instructions, but they require checking out private GitHub repo.
replies.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: It would be nice to have a default which just loads up Presto Java workers.  That would ensure this test actually works, and potentially spot and document discrepancies between Java vs. custom workers. (Also, it would allow us to include at least that version in our CI system.)
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand this suggestion. The queries are very simple and there is not much benefit in running them against Java workers. The verification is happening using H2 just like any other test, hence, there should not be any concern about the test's correctness. Am I missing something?
replies.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I missed this, how is verification happening with H2?  My only point was, if we don't want to introduce a dependency from PrestoDB (Java source) to C++ native worker source which exists somewhere else, but still want to make sure that future tests are sane, it would be nice to have a default, and an easy way to accomplish that would have the default be a vanilla Java worker to serve as a baseline.  Not sure how H2 verification is happening in this test.  The default would test the native worker launcher only.
replies.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText: assertQuery("SELECT * FROM nation"); runs the query using queryRunner (native workers) and H2, then compares the results.
replies.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: Maybe use createTempDirectory. Some OS doesn't have /tmp dir.
timeline.author: highker

timeline.bodyText: maybe just fail it hard and force the caller to set "node-scheduler.include-coordinator", "false"?
timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText: @highker Not sure I understand the suggestion. Would you like me to assert that coordinatorProperties include "node-scheduler.include-coordinator" with the value of "false"?
replies.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: Move the first param to its own line
timeline.author: highker
